name: Brandon Powers
text: We enjoy to go out. Yesterday we  visited this delicious restaurant which friends told us about. We enjoyed a lovely evening there with delicious food and  an experienced crew and  a professional chief cook. We  added this venue in our phone list  and we shall definitely return soon.  Highly recommended.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: Kyle Jones
text:
Good looking store, different quality pizzas than other Anthony’s branches. This is not about my expectations it’s very clear;
Where is feta cheese in my pizza (check out my picture)
Did you see any Arugula in the picture?
If you don’t have enough stuff please don’t make my pizza. Not just my pizza for any other customers.
I ate Mediterranean pizza one day before in Anthony’s veterans Highway location, Pizza was great a lot of green stuff and Feta cheese,
I order second day in this branch, Totally different I’n disappointed there’s no arugulas, no feta, little cheese...
Also they say “contact us, I send an e mail 7/11/19 with pictures, nobody response.
I don’t want anything free but they should answer for better customer service.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: Lynn Perez
text: Cool and cozy place to eat! Nicely decorated, friendly staff. You can see the coal fired pizza oven and smell the pizza cooking. I had the Arugula salad which was delicious and the traditional pizza. Everything was so tasty! Fun little place to eat.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: Stephen Wong
text: Excellent value. Joining awards program is great way to earning free items . Service by bartender Victoria was outstanding,  attentive and always correct in what to select for choices. Weds is free meatballs with ricotta at the bar.

name: Pat B

name: Sanjay Kapur
text: The concept is good and I was really hoping I would like the pizza but it underwhelmed me. These ovens are supposed to be very hot and cook quickly. Then why does it take forever to get the pizza to the table?  Sometimes it feels like it waited quite a long time between the time it was taken out of the oven and put on the table.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: gaby bermudez
text: Pizza didnt taste bad and the place has a good ambiance, but we ordered the square margherita pizza which says it's topped with basil. It literally came with 2 branches of basil at either corner. Even if I spread it out myself it's not enough to cover the large pizza. I would not recommend this if you are getting it for take out as pizza got cold after a 10 minute ride in a heated car.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: Rick A
text: Not all Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza's are the same, at least when it comes to customer service.  So if you've been burned by one, which I have, the location can certainly make a difference.  The manager is obviously earning his salary here as this place is run extremely professionally.  If either Kay or Christian are helping you, you will always leave with a smile.  Top notch.  Thank you for the consistently great food and service.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: margo rosenman

name: James Mancuso
text: The decor inside is quite entertaining. The walls are adorned with portraits of famous movie, TV, and sports stars as well as singers. Additional seating outside is perfect on summer nights. The menu is a bit limited at first glance but the quality of the food more than makes up for it. We have tried both the white pizza and the eggplant pizza and both were delicious. Lastly the price range will not break the bank. All in all it is a pleasant dining experience for the family or for a less formal date night.

name: Robert Corbett
text:
I found the new location, in Stonybrook LI, which I've wanted to try since it was being constructed, to be well appointed, and the staff to be friendly and efficient.  However, being it's the onset of winter, unless the dining room is full, they shouldn't seat patrons next to the window. Having the pizza stand up against these cold window cause the pizza to cool down immediately. By the time I finished, it was like eating it right out of a refrigerator.

Other than that, it was quite good, albeit somewhat pricey for pizza. With all the options everywhere, one can get as good or better for far less.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818

name: Mike Voigt
text: We always order the same thing. 20 wings /onions /bread appetizer, garden family style salad w/cheese and an entrée each. I got the shells and 2 meatballs (which they say is for 5) lol I ate half of the shells and 1 meatball and honestly I could have devoured the entire plate but decided to eat the other half today for leftovers. The other 3 people in the party ordered the eggplant. Everyone loved every morsel and cleaned their plate. 2 of us had a beer from their extensive ipa list. Love that they display the alcohol content percentage. They also allowed me to sample a flute of the forgettaboutit. Friendly staff and they didn't rush us out. We'll be back!

name: Gregory Lella
text: Bland sauce, decent pizza. Fast and polite service, with one huge exception. When we asked for oregano, crushed red pepper, and garlic powder, they gave us this condescending and arrogant line about how their pizza was "so flavorful" we weren't ALLOWED to have oregano or red pepper because it would "overpower and ruin" it. The pizza was, in fact, average and not that flavorful. The sauce was bland and there wasn't enough of it. It needed spices. They did offer us chopped up fresh garlic, but that's ten times more overpowering than proper spices are anyway. If you want real pizza in the Stony Brook area (without the side of arrogance), try Station by the SBU LIRR station or Luigi's up 25A. I genuinely don't understand five star reviews.
key: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza 2302 Nesconset Hwy STONY BROOK NY 11790-3509 (631) 444-0818
